definitions.definition: To make (someone or oneself) aware of some information ; to inform , to notify .
examples: The ears apprise the brain of sound.

definitions.definition: ( rare ) To formally impart (information) to someone; to advise , to notify.

main_definition: To make (someone or oneself) aware of some information ; to inform , to notify .
secondary_definitions: ( rare ) To formally impart (information) to someone; to advise , to notify.

definitions.definition: Synonym of appraise ( “ to determine the value or worth of (something) ” ) .
To put a price on (something) for the purpose of sale ; to appraise.

main_definition: Synonym of appraise ( “ to determine the value or worth of (something) ” ) .
secondary_definitions: ( specifically , Scots law ) To put a price on (something) for the purpose of sale ; to appraise.
